having a shape, surface, pattern etc that is not even, smooth, or balanced
It has a highly irregular shape, covered in bumps and indentations.
not happening at times that are an equal distance from each other
He’s receiving medication for an irregular heartbeat.
Beamish only returned to Britain at irregular intervals.
not happening or done at the normal time for doing something
Funeral directors often work long, irregular hours.
not obeying the usually accepted legal or moral rules
It would be highly irregular (=extremely irregular) for a minister to accept payments of this kind.
a word meaning constipated (=unable to easily pass food waste from your body), used in order to be polite
a soldier who is not an official member of a country’s army
not obeying the usually accepted legal or moral rules
There were some warning signals that something irregular was going on.
